intro: Syngonanthus glaber, commonly known as the smooth thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Syngonanthus glaber is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
